article.headline: Illinois St. 77, Illinois-Chicago 69
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Freshman Osiris Eldridge had a career-high 19 points and junior Boo Richardson added 17 to lead Illinois State to a 77-69 victory over Illinois-Chicago on Saturday. Illinois-Chicago announced that coach Jimmy Collins would be taking a leave of absence. School officials said a timetable for the 59-year-old Collins' return had not been established. Collins, a former assistant at Illinois, took over the program in 1996. The loss was the third straight for the Flames (6-8). Dominitrix Johnson added 14 points for Illinois State (8-4). Reserve guard T.J. Gray was 4-of-6 from 3-point range and had 14 points for the Flames, while Jovan Stefanov scored 12 points and Othyus Jeffers had 10 points and 10 rebounds. The Flames, who were 11-of-22 on 3s and shot 41.3 percent from the field overall, trailed for most of the game. But they erased an 11-point deficit in the second half and led twice in the last five minutes, the last time at 67-66 on a dunk by Danijel Zoric with 3:35 to play. The Redbirds responded with a closing 11-2 run. Eldridge hit a jumper and combined with Richardson to go 9-of-10 from the free throw line in the spurt.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
